text24.content: 1. Smallpox: Smallpox was a severe and contagious disease caused by the variola virus. Patients infected by the virus developed fever, bodyaches, and a distinctive rash that developed into fluid-filled blisters. The disease was known for its high mortality rate and the permanent scarring itoften left on survivors. Historically, it affected people across various continents. Through a global vaccination campaign, smallpox became the firstdisease to be eradicated by human effort. 📃 Read more on our page on smallpox.

1. Smallpox: Smallpox was a severe and contagious disease caused by the variola virus. Patients infected by the virus developed fever, bodyaches, and a distinctive rash that developed into fluid-filled blisters. The disease was known for its high mortality rate and the permanent scarring itoften left on survivors. Historically, it affected people across various continents. Through a global vaccination campaign, smallpox became the firstdisease to be eradicated by human effort. 📃 Read more on our page on smallpox.
